Clinical: Diarrhoea. Elephantiasis arabum. Gastric affections. Headache. Leprosy. Scleriasis. Scleroderma. Sight, defective. Skin, affections of. Sore throat.
Characteristics: Proved by Mure, it produced lancinations, burning, bruised and throbbing pains. Notable symptoms of leprosy and of scleroderma appear in the provings: anaesthesia; swelling and hardening of skin. Among other symptoms are: sensation as if a peg stuck in false ribs. Swelling of parts. The greatest number of symptoms appeared on the lower extremities and skin. < From cold drinks (colic); from descending stairs (lancinations); from breathing. > Rest.
Eyes: Sight weak; confused vision by candle-light.
He makes letters much too large.
Unable to look steadily at an object.
Mouth: Burning in tongue; has to stop eating.
Throat: Lancinations in throat when swallowing; stinging when swallowing saliva.
Stomach: Vomiting of a cake immediately after eating it.
Abdomen: Pain with bruised sensation in abdomen.
Respiratory Organs: Pain in middle of chest as if pricked by needles.
Lancinations every five minutes in r. chest.
Neck: Constrictive pains round neck as if from tight string.
Upper Limbs: Insensibility of hand to fire-heat when approached to fire, but an hour after he feels it badly.
Lower Limbs: Sharp pain lower part of l. leg as if a pen-knife were stuck in.
Hammering in tibia, nape of neck, and r. foot.
Soreness of soles of feet when walking and when touched.
Generalities: Lancinations in various parts, esp. when going downstairs.
Skin: On each side of epigastrium skin seems thickened, with pain in last false ribs as if a peg were stuck in them.
Swelling, roughness, and itching of skin of l. leg.
Small vesicles appear on swollen r. leg; and l. arm; and on other parts without swelling.
